name: ping_scan
description: Network discovery using ICMP/ARP requests to identify live hosts without port scanning. Fastest and least intrusive option for initial reconnaissance. Uses -sn flag.

name: quick_scan
description: Scans top 100 common ports (HTTP, SSH, FTP, SMB, RDP, etc.) with aggressive timing. Completes in seconds to minutes. Best starting point for most assessments.

name: port_scan
description: Targeted scan of specific ports or ranges. Use when you know which services to investigate. More efficient than full scans.

name: service_scan
description: Probes open ports for exact service versions (e.g., 'Apache 2.4.41' vs 'http'). Critical for CVE matching and vulnerability assessment. Uses -sV flag.

ports.description: Optional: limit to specific ports for faster scans. Default scans top 1000 ports.

name: comprehensive_scan
description: Full aggressive scan: OS detection, version detection, NSE scripts, and traceroute. Most thorough option but highly visible and slow (minutes to hours). Requires authorization.

target.description: Single IP or hostname (not recommended for large ranges)

name: stealth_scan
description: TCP SYN scan that never completes handshake for reduced logging. Harder to detect but not invisible to modern IDS/IPS. REQUIRES ROOT/ADMIN privileges.

ports.description: Optional: specific ports to scan. Default scans top 1000 ports.
